speaker: Sophie
text: I was a bit annoyed at the feedback I got. Liam said I should’ve thought more about accessibility.
ipa: aɪ wəz ə bɪt əˈnɔɪd ət ðə ˈfidˌbæk aɪ ɡɑt. ˈliəm sɛd aɪ ˈʃʊdəv θɔt mɔr əˈbaʊt əkˌsɛsəˈbɪləti.
stress: I was a BIT ANNOYED at the FEEDBACK I GOT. LIAM said I SHOULD’VE THOUGHT more about ACCESSIBILITY.
linking:
"bit annoyed" → /bɪt əˈnɔɪd/ (t + a linking)
"should’ve thought" → /ˈʃʊdəv θɔt/ (v + th linking)

speaker: Jake
text: Yeah, I heard about that. But honestly, I think he was just trying to help you with your layout choices.
ipa: jæ, aɪ hɜrd əˈbaʊt ðæt. bət ˈɑnəstli, aɪ θɪŋk hi wəz dʒəst ˈtraɪɪŋ tə hɛlp ju wɪð jʊr ˈleɪˌaʊt ˈʧɔɪsɪz.
stress: YEAH, I HEARD about THAT. But HONESTLY, I THINK he was just TRYING to HELP you with your LAYOUT CHOICES.
linking:
"heard about" → /hɜrd əˈbaʊt/ (d + a linking)
"trying to" → /ˈtraɪɪŋ tə/ (g + t linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: I get it. I just didn’t expect him to laugh at my variable names in front of the whole team.
ipa: aɪ ɡɛt ɪt. aɪ dʒəst ˈdɪdənt ɪkˈspɛkt hɪm tə læf ət maɪ ˈvɛriəbəl neɪmz ɪn frʌnt əv ðə hoʊl tim.
stress: I GET IT. I just DIDN’T EXPECT him to LAUGH at my VARIABLE NAMES in FRONT of the WHOLE TEAM.
linking:
"get it" → /ɡɛt ɪt/ (t + i linking)
"laugh at" → /læf ət/ (f + a linking)

speaker: Jake
text: Ouch. I would’ve been upset about that too. But maybe next time, just talk to him directly?
ipa: aʊʧ. aɪ ˈwʊdəv bɪn əpˈsɛt əˈbaʊt ðæt tu. bət ˈmeɪbi nɛkst taɪm, dʒəst tɔk tə hɪm dəˈrɛktli?
stress: OUCH. I WOULD’VE BEEN UPSET about THAT TOO. But MAYBE NEXT TIME, just TALK to him DIRECTLY?
linking:
"would’ve been" → /ˈwʊdəv bɪn/ (v + b linking)
"talk to" → /tɔk tə/ (k + t linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: True. I was thinking about doing that, but I wasn’t sure how to bring it up. I’m scared of conflict.
ipa: tru. aɪ wəz ˈθɪŋkɪŋ əˈbaʊt ˈduɪŋ ðæt, bət aɪ ˈwɑzənt ʃʊr haʊ tə brɪŋ ɪt ʌp. aɪm skɛrd əv ˈkɑnflɪkt.
stress: TRUE. I was THINKING about DOING THAT, but I WASN’T SURE how to BRING it UP. I’m SCARED of CONFLICT.
linking:
"thinking about" → /ˈθɪŋkɪŋ əˈbaʊt/ (g + a linking)
"bring it" → /brɪŋ ɪt/ (g + i linking)

speaker: Jake
text: Come on, you’re too good at what you do to let that stop you. Besides, he usually responds well to direct conversations.
ipa: kʌm ɑn, jʊr tu ɡʊd ət wʌt ju du tə lɛt ðæt stɑp ju. bɪˈsaɪdz, hi ˈjuʒuəli rɪˈspɑndz wɛl tə dəˈrɛkt ˌkɑnvərˈseɪʃənz.
stress: COME ON, you’re TOO GOOD at WHAT YOU DO to LET that STOP YOU. BESIDES, he USUALLY RESPONDS WELL to DIRECT CONVERSATIONS.
linking:
"come on" → /kʌm ɑn/ (m + o linking)
"stop you" → /stɑp ju/ (p + y linking)

speaker: Sophie
text: You're right. Thanks for the advice — I’ll talk to him after the sprint demo.
ipa: jʊr raɪt. θæŋks fɔr ði ədˈvaɪs — aɪl tɔk tə hɪm ˈæftər ðə sprɪnt ˈdɛmoʊ.
stress: YOU'RE RIGHT. THANKS for the ADVICE — I’ll TALK to him AFTER the SPRINT DEMO.
linking:
"talk to" → /tɔk tə/ (k + t linking)
"after the" → /ˈæftər ðə/ (r + th linking)
